snippet: The Rangers’ Ryan McDonagh led all skaters in ice time with 53:17 of the 114:41, blocked eight shots and helped shut down the Capitals star Alex Ovechkin in the triple overtime game.
abstract: New York Rangers defenseman Ryan McDonagh skated more than 53 minutes in team's triple-overtime playoff victory over Washington Capitals, the most of any player. Charts, Photo (M)

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and TIM WENDEL

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- There was no practice for the Rangers or the Capitals on Thursday. They were still recovering from Wednesday's Game 3, which took 4 hours 34 minutes and three overtimes to finish. Perhaps no one earned the rest more than Rangers defenseman Ryan McDonagh, who led all skaters in ice time with 53:17 of the 114:41 -- meaning he played 46.5 percent of the game.

headline.main: Some Rest for the Weary: An Iron Man in Game 3 Earns a Day Off
